result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: matter set for plea/sent 12/13/22 at 8:30
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Zackary A Partridge
Current: 433 County Road G, Plainfield, WI 54966   (Effective: 07-25-2022)
Prior: 533 County Highway G, Plainfield, WI 54966
Defendant Record Update
Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire & Waiver filed by Atty Shunette Campbell Hunter

3:18 PM 
Defendant Zackary A Partridge in court.  Attorney Shunette Torna Campbell in court for Zackary A Partridge.  Attorney Robert J Jambois in court for State of Wisconsin. 
ADA Jambois calls the case and states appearances.
Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

BY THE COURT:
Defendant bound for trial.

Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered for counts 1 and 2.

BY THE COURT:
Matter set for pre-trial conference 10-24-2022.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on October 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.

2:10 PM Defendant Zackary A Partridge appeared by video, in custody from Waupaca.  Attorney Shunette Torna Campbell in court for Zackary A Partridge.  Prosecuting attorney Kelly A Cassidy in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Attorney does not waive time limits for the preliminary hearing to be held.
Atty Torna Campbell request placement in the Portage County Jail due to issues at the Waupaca County Jail.
Court states that is a jail administrative issue.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on September 26, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Atty Shunette Campbell Hunter appointed

2:28 PM Defendant Zackary A Partridge appeared by video, in custody at Portage County Jail.  Attorney Jedidiah Dodge in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant appears without counsel.
Defendant had counsel but counsel had withdrawn.
Defendant wishes to have counsel.
Defendant has not been in contact with the public defender's office.
Defendant is on a PO hold.

BY THE COURT: 
Defendant to contact the public defender's office to see about other counsel being appointed.
Case to be adjourned.
Bond is continued,
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 6, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

1:05 PM Defendant Zackary Partridge in court.  Attorney Andrew August Mutchler in court for State of WI. Attorney Taylor Soule appears on behalf of the defendant.

ADA Mutchler states facts for anticipated charges of Possession of Methamphetamine and Felony Bail Jumping. 
Atty Soule does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

Atty Soule states the public defender's office will be appointing an attorney for the defendant.

State requests a $1000 signature bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Soule does not have any objections as to bond.
Hearing scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
